triples.name: Deliberative democracy
triples.relevance: The paper builds on the theory of deliberative democracy which emphasizes authentic deliberation in decision-making.

triples.name: Sortition
triples.relevance: The paper references sortition (random sampling) as a method for selecting participants in deliberative democracy.

triples.name: Citizens' assembly
triples.relevance: Citizens' assemblies represent the mini-publics that the paper studies to scale deliberation benefits beyond these localized groups.

triples.name: Deliberative opinion poll
triples.relevance: Deliberative opinion polls are a practical implementation of deliberative democracy that the paper builds upon.

triples.name: Civic engagement
triples.relevance: The paper examines civic engagement through deliberation and its impact on voter behavior and participation.

triples.name: Voting behavior
triples.relevance: The paper investigates how deliberative processes influence voting behavior and voter decision-making.

triples.name: Field experiment
triples.relevance: The paper employs field experiments with public deliberation and one-year follow-up to test effects on voter behavior.

triples.name: Elections in the United States
triples.relevance: The paper tests its deliberation intervention in the context of mid-term U.S. elections.

triples.name: Scaling deliberation for broader society
triples.relevance: The paper proposes using organized deliberative processes scaled beyond mini-publics to create more deliberative voters.

triples.name: Automated deliberation using technology
triples.relevance: The paper investigates whether technology can assist with scaling organized deliberative processes.
